data.title: Get Ready to Roar! UAPB Announces Exciting UPROAR: New Student Week and Welcome Week Schedule 2024
data.meta_description: The University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff (UAPB) is thrilled to announce the UPROAR: New Student Week and Welcome Week 2024 schedule, designed to welcome and integrate new and returning students into the campus community. UPROAR: New Student Week will take place from Aug. 19-24, targeting incoming first-year students with events to ease their transition…
data.text:
The University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff (UAPB) is thrilled to announce the UPROAR: New Student Week and Welcome Week 2024 schedule, designed as a welcome to the Pridelands and to integrate new and returning students into the campus community. UPROAR: New Student Week will take place from Aug. 19-24, targeting incoming first-year students with events to ease their transition into university life. UAPB Welcome Week starts Aug. 25 with the first day of instruction starting August 26.

UAPB UPROAR Week for New Students Starts August 19

The UAPB UPROAR week will kick off with the much-anticipated New Student Move-In, where freshmen assigned to Stevens Hall and Johnson Hall will move in during the morning shift from 8 a.m. to noon, and those assigned to the Delta Housing Complex, Copeland Hall, and Fischer Hall will move in during the afternoon shift from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. Guided campus tours will be offered from noon to 1 p.m., starting at the L.A. Davis Student Union, followed by the Freshman Welcome Ceremony at 6 p.m. in the H.O. Clemmons Arena and a Welcome Celebration from 7:30 p.m. to 10:30 p.m. at the W.E. O’Bryant Bell Tower.

Tuesday, Aug. 20, the following day begins with “How to LEAD at UAPB” from 9 a.m. to 9:50 a.m. in the Henderson-Young Business Building, featuring the Student Involvement & Leadership and the Student Government Association. “UAPB 101: An Introductory Course to Campus Success” will take place from 10 a.m. to 11:30 a.m., with presentations from TRIO Student Support Services, John B. Watson Memorial Library, and Career Services. In the afternoon, from 2 p.m. to 3:30 p.m., students will attend “A Guide to University Living,” featuring the Office of the Dean of Student Life, University Police & Public Safety, and Student Health & Wellness. Additional activities include:

Guided campus tours start at 3:30 p.m.

Student ID processing at the Campus Public Safety Office.

A visit to the University Museum & Culture Center (UMCC) in Childress Hall.

The day concludes with Campus Traditions Night from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. at the W.E. O’Bryant Bell Tower.

Wednesday, Aug. 21, features the mandatory Gathering of the Pride orientation for new students from 10 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. at the Henderson-Young Business Building. Students can then get professional headshots taken from noon to 2 p.m. at the L.A. Davis Student Union and enjoy Pine Bluff DAZE from 1:30 p.m. to 3:30 p.m. at the W.E. O’Bryant Bell Tower. The day ends with an outdoor movie screening from 7:30 p.m. to 10 p.m., also at the Bell Tower.

Thursday, Aug. 22, offers a diverse range of activities, including kickball, outdoor aerobics, a Day Party sponsored by Aramark Food Services, Karaoke & Game Night, and a Freshman Lock-In. This rich variety is curated to keep students excited and engaged throughout the day.

Friday, Aug. 23, begins with the Freshman Class Photo, a tradition commemorating the start of their higher education journey. Paw Painting is a fun activity that shows the Golden Lion school spirit. The academic Open Houses provide an empowering opportunity for students to learn more about their respective schools and the resources available to them.

Saturday, Aug. 24, concludes New Student Week with the 2nd Annual FRESH-Start Freshman Leadership Summit, sponsored by Sam’s Club, from 9 a.m. to noon, and the Back to School Bash from 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. at Simmons Bank Field.

UAPB Welcome Week 2024 Continues the Excitement

Following the UPROAR: New Student Week, UAPB will continue the excitement with Welcome Week from Aug. 25-31, targeting all students to foster community and school spirit. Sunday, Aug. 25, features a Splash Bash from 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. at the Pumphrey Soccer Complex and the Chancellor’s Ice Cream Social from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. at the W.E. O’Bryant Bell Tower.

On Monday, Aug. 26, the Do’s & Don’t Fashion Show will be held in the STEM Conference Room from 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. Tuesday, Aug. 27, offers Meet the Greeks from 7 p.m. to 9 p.m. in the STEM Conference Room. Wednesday, Aug. 28, includes Pretty Wednesday from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at the W.E. O’Bryant Bell Tower, Lion Yearbook Pictures from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. at the L.A. Davis Student Union, the Registered Student Organization Fair from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m., and a Silent Headphone Party from 8 p.m. to 11 p.m. at the Bell Tower.

Thursday, Aug. 29, will feature the Golden Lions vs Razorback Game Watch Party from 6:30 p.m. to 9 p.m. at the L.A. Davis Student Union, Chick-fil-A area. Friday, Aug. 30, includes the Welcome Back Cookout & Open House from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. and the NPHC Yard Show from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. at John B. Watson Library. Finally, Saturday, Aug. 1, concludes Welcome Week with the 2024 L.A. Torrence Institute for Excellence in Student Leadership from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. and a Gym Jam from 10 p.m. to 2 a.m. at H.O. Clemmons Arena, offering a diverse range of activities to cater to different student interests.

“We are excited to welcome our new and returning students to campus with a robust schedule of events designed to help them connect, engage, and thrive,” said Frank D. Dorsey, II, UAPB Dean of Student Involvement & Leadership. UPROAR and Welcome Week are integral to fostering a sense of belonging and community at the University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff.”
